meanings.definition: bossies (noun): a term of endearment for a boss or supervisor
meanings.sent1: My bossies always motivates me to do my best at work.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their bossies' birthday with a surprise party.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly told my bossies that they should give us a raise.
meanings.sent4: The bossies of the company steered us in the right direction during the crisis.
meanings.sent5: The new bossies quickly gained the respect of the team with their leadership skills.

meanings.definition: bossies (adjective): showing characteristics of a boss or supervisor
meanings.sent1: Her bossies attitude made her a natural leader among her peers.
meanings.sent2: The confident employee had a bossies demeanor that commanded respect.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted around the house with a bossies air of authority.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a bossies display of power and dominance.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood tall and proud, a bossies symbol of strength and resilience.
